sub_title: Owner of Intercultural Business Communication, Tailor-made language trainings, Business German, German for diplomats
summary:
Elvira Groot was amongst other jobs one ot the authors of the course book for Business German "Marktchance Wirtschaftsdeutsch - Mittelstufe", a teacher's manual "Wirtschaftsdeutsch für Anfänger - Lehrerhandbuch" and a German Grammar "Deutsch - Grammatik, Rechtschreibung und Zeichensetzung".

Elvira studied Geman and English Linguistics and Literature at the Universities of Düsseldorf (Germany) and Reading (UK).

She started her career as a research assistant at Heinrich-Heine-University at which she contributed to a range of European research projects focusing on intercultural communication and on culture-specific communication patterns.

Alongside her academic career, Elvira has provided hands-on coaching and cross-cultural training for managers of multinational companies in Germany, including AMS Management Systems, Johnson & Johnson, E.On, Siemens and Henkel.

Having lived herself with her family in the UK, the Netherlands and Nigeria, Elvira has first-hand experience of being an expat and facing the challenges of everyday life in a foreign culture. Since 2004 Elvira has lived in The Netherlands, where she founded "Intercultural Business Communication" in 2008.

Now she coaches expatriate staff and teaches German as foreign language with a strong focus on intercultural communication at, amongst others, European Patent Office, Goethe Institut and Leiden University.

projects:
[{'title': "Blended Learning project ‘Grammar mini-tutorials en Formatief toetsen voor Duits'​", 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'This Blended Learning project aims at developing online grammar mini-tutorials and corresponding tests, so that students can study the fundamentals of grammar by themselves. Thus, in the classroom there will be more time left to practice the grammatical structures in different communicative settings.
For each grammatical topic, a grammar tutorial will be produced, consisting of a powerpoint presentation and a video with explanations of the grammar. In total, approximately 100 videos will be produced to cover the grammar for the A1 level (CEFRL).', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Elvira', 'last_name': 'Groot', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Owner of Intercultural Business Communication, Tailor-made language trainings, Business German, German for diplomats'}]}, {'title': 'Didaktisierung von Videos für das Goethe Institut Stockholm, Schweden: SC Freiburg', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': None, 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Elvira', 'last_name': 'Groot', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Owner of Intercultural Business Communication, Tailor-made language trainings, Business German, German for diplomats'}]}, {'title': 'Deutschland News kurz & knapp - Aktuelles aus Deutschland - Ein Newsletter für Deutschlerner', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'The launch of the latest project of Intercultural Business Communication gives learners of German the opportunity to practise their German with easy to read texts and learn interesting facts about German culture, politics, economy, sports, … all the topics people talk about in Germany.

By using authentic German newspaper articles which are simplified, shortened and added by word explanations in English, it makes the newsletter a pleasant experience of getting the latest news about Germany and practising your German.

If you are interested in receiving this newsletter, please send an email to Deutschland.News@xs4all.nl

', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Elvira', 'last_name': 'Groot', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Owner of Intercultural Business Communication, Tailor-made language trainings, Business German, German for diplomats'}]}, {'title': 'GEMEENTEMUSEUM DEN HAAG: Deutsch im Museum / Duits in het museum / German at the museum', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': '"Deutsch im Museum" was a language course programme on behalf of the Goethe Institut Rotterdam, targeted at staff working at the Gemeentemuseum Den Haag. They either work for PR or marketing but as well for the curators of the different collections.
The main focus was to improve the speaking ability and to enable the staff to use the German language for professional purposes.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Elvira', 'last_name': 'Groot', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Owner of Intercultural Business Communication, Tailor-made language trainings, Business German, German for diplomats'}]}, {'title': 'Didaktisierung von Videos und Audios für das Goethe Institut Stockholm, Schweden', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': None, 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Elvira', 'last_name': 'Groot', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Owner of Intercultural Business Communication, Tailor-made language trainings, Business German, German for diplomats'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Johanna', 'last_name': 'Scholtyssek', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Beauftragte für Sprachkursorganisation  bei Goethe Institut Rotterdam'}, {'type': 'nonStandardizedContributor', 'first_name': None, 'last_name': None, 'name': 'Olga Lucy Rutecka', 'headline': None}]}, {'title': 'Kies Duits - Promotion of the German Language at the Rijnlands Lyceum in Wassenaar/ Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'description': 'The aim of this project is to promote the German language amongst the pupils at the Rijnlands Lyceum in Wassenaar.
To start with, the team investigated which steps could be taken in order to make German more attractive to choose as a school subject and to achieve a better insight of the importance of German for the Dutch, both in economy and politics.
In the second phase, the team is going to contact people and institutions with a key function to support the aim of the project, such as the Goethe Institut, Dutch companies who do business with Germany etc. ', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Elvira', 'last_name': 'Groot', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Owner of Intercultural Business Communication, Tailor-made language trainings, Business German, German for diplomats'}]}, {'title': 'Business German for the Gas Storage Industry', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}}, 'description': None, 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Elvira', 'last_name': 'Groot', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Owner of Intercultural Business Communication, Tailor-made language trainings, Business German, German for diplomats'}]}]
